headline: S&P Global to Present at the BofA Securities Information and Business Services Conference 2026 on March 12, 2026
summary: Mark Grant, Senior Vice President of Investor Relations and Treasurer of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), will participate in the BofA Securities Information and Business Services Conference 2026 on March 12, 2026, in New York, NY. Mr. Grant is scheduled to speak from 9:20 a.m. to 9:55 a.m. (Eastern Daylight Time). The "fireside chat" will be webcast and may include forward-looking information. Heather Balsky, Senior Director of Investor Relations, will join for investor meetings.

headline: How The Story Is Shifting For S&P Global (SPGI) As Targets And AI Risks Reset
summary: S&P Global’s refreshed model fair value has been reset from about US$610.50 to about US$537.90, a move of roughly US$72.60 that reframes where the central price target sits today. That reset lines up with Street research that clusters around lower targets as analysts weigh competitive pressure in data, AI related risks, and what investors are willing to pay for the group. Read on to see how you can track this evolving narrative and what to watch as the story develops. Analyst Price Targets...

headline: S&P Global Expands Private Credit Benchmarks While CERAWeek Underlines Reach
summary: S&P Global (NYSE:SPGI) has launched the S&P Lincoln Senior Debt Index Series, expanding its index offering into the private loan and direct lending market. The company is also hosting its annual CERAWeek energy conference, bringing together policymakers and industry leaders including the U.S. Secretary of Energy. S&P Global, best known for its indices and credit ratings, is pushing further into private credit with new benchmarks designed for the growing direct lending segment. For investors...

headline: These 2 Beaten-Down Stocks Could Stage a Comeback, Says Oppenheimer
summary: So much is going on, it’s hard to know where to start. There are always doomsayers, but recent economic data can’t be pleasing them. Q4 earnings are better than predicted, and with some 85% of the S&P-listed companies having reported, we can see that revenues are up almost 9% and earnings are up more than 12%. Quarterly GDP growth has slowed, but remains sound at 1.4%. Analysts expect a bump when the Q1 numbers come in and the effects of the understated Federal Government shutdown finish ripplin

headline: Nasdaq and S&P are set for worst month since March. Here’s how to navigate the shift
summary: Technology stocks aren’t carrying the market like they used to — but investors can protect their portfolios during the volatility.

headline: Private equity enters its 'Darwinian' era as experts warn some funds face extinction
summary: Lower exits, longer holding periods, smaller returns, and tougher fundraising conditions are reshaping the industry, where only the strongest managers will survive.

raw.headline: Private equity enters its 'Darwinian' era as experts warn some funds face extinction
